title: Graph First Inequality
text: Graph $$x \geq 3$$. Recognize that it is a vertical line through $$x=3$$.

title: Graph the Boundary Line
text: It is a solid line because the inequality sign is $$ \geq $$.

title: Shade in the Side of the Boundary Line
text: A test point should be a point not on the line. Choose $$(0,0)$$ as a test point to see if it is a solution.\n$$x \geq 3$$\n$$0 \geq 3$$

title: Shade in the Side of the Boundary Line
text: $$(0,0)$$ is not a solution to $$x \geq 3$$. Since $$(0,0)$$ is on the left side of the line, so we shade in the right side of the line $$x=3$$ in green.\n##figure4.gif##

title: Graph Second Inequality
text: Graph $$y \leq 2$$ on the same grid. Recognize that it is a horizontal line through $$y=2$$.

title: Graph the Boundary Line
text: It is a solid line because the inequality sign is $$ \leq $$.

title: Shade in the Side of the Boundary Line
text: A test point should be a point not on the line. Choose $$(0,0)$$ as a test point to see if it is a solution.\n$$y \leq 2$$\n$$0 \leq 2$$

title: Shade in the Side of the Boundary Line
text: $$(0,0)$$ is a solution to $$y \leq 2$$. Since $$(0,0)$$ is on the bottom side of the line, so we shade in the bottom side of the line $$y=2$$ in green.\n##figure8.gif##

title: Overlap Shading
text: The solution is all points in the darker shaded region.
